alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 28 at 1:10PM EDT until August 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern West Virginia, including the following counties, Boone and Kanawha. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations will continue through the afternoon. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from this morning`s heavy rainfall to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 108 PM EDT, Radar and rain gauges indicated between 2 and 5 inches of rain fell this morning. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Left Fork Lens Creek, Brush Creek, Laurel Creek, Mill Branch, Rock Creek, Big Coal Creek, Joes Creek, Left Fork Rock Creek, Joes Branch, Lens Creek, Hopkins Fork, Left Fork Joes Creek, Slaughter Creek, Bradley Fork, Honeycamp Fork and Big Coal River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Racine and Seth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
